alert.note: Alert for Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 9:01AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from heavy rain on Friday is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following county, Noble. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 AM EDT, flooding of Duck Creek and its tributaries is occurring. Road closures include portions of SR-260 and SR-146. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caldwell, Dudley, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Sarahsville, Dexter City, Harriettsville and Wolf Run State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
